src:
Pasar Hatchback Anjlok, Honda Masih Optimistis
06 Nov 2019, 05:37 by Bisnis.com, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Honda Prospect Motor (HPM) menyatakan bahwa penurunan penjualan segmen sedan hatchback sejalan dengan penurunan penjualan secara total di pasar domestik.
Direktur Inovasi Bisnis dan Penjualan Pemasaran HPM Yusak Billy menuturkan hal ini terlihat dari pangsa pasar segmen ini yang tidak banyak berubah terhadap total pasar kendaraan nasional.
Menurutnya, kontribusi segmen sedan buntung terhadap total pasar domestik masih berada di kisaran 3 persen. Tidak banyak berubah kendati secara total, sepanjang Januari—September penurunannya mencapai sekitar 16 persen secara tahunan.
“Pasar hatchback Januari—September turun sekitar 16 persen dibanding periode yang sama tahun lalu seiring market yang drop juga sebesar 13 persen. Namun, kontribusi penjualan hatchback di market tidak terlalu turun masih sekitar 3 persen,” katanya kepada Bisnis.com, Selasa, 5 November 2019.
Dengan kondisi tersebut, menurutnya, dominasi Honda di pasar sedan hatchback tidak mengalami banyak perubahan. Pabrikan asal Jepang ini, lanjutnya, masih merajai pasar melalui model Jazz yang memiliki pangsa pasar sekitar 46 persen.
Permintaan pasar pada semester II/2019 juga dinilai lebih baik dibandingkan dengan semester I/2019. Namun, dia menuturkan bahwa pada periode Oktober atau awal kuartal terakhir tahun ini mulai terjadi kembali penurunan yang sementara.
"Jadi memang total hatchback kami saat ini mengalami penurunan secara tahunan sebesar 16 persen. Model 5D turun 30 persen secara tahunan, sedangkan Jazz turun sekitar 15 persen pada periode tersebut,” katanya.
Mengutip data Gabungan Industri Kendaraan Bermotor Indonesia (Gaikindo), tercatat sedikitnya ada tujuh merek yang memasarkan model sedan buntung pada tahun ini, di antaranya Suzuki, Toyota, Honda, dan Mini.
Sepanjang Januari—September, penjualan sedan hatchback di pasar domestik mencapai sekitar 30.953 unit, menurun 24,18 persen dibandingkan periode yang sama pada tahun sebelumnya.
Penurunan ini lebih tinggi dari kondisi industri yang mengalami kontraksi 12,03 persen secara tahunan.
Honda masih tercatat sebagai penguasa pasar dengan penjualan sedan hatchback tertinggi, mencapai 9.467 unit. Penjualan ini dikontribusi oleh performa penjualan model Jazz dan Civic 5D yang masing-masing terjual 8.481 unit dan 986 unit.
Kendati masih menguasai sekitar 30,59 persen pasar pada segmen ini, penjualan Honda tercatat mengalami penurunan cukup signifikan. Total penjualan sedan hatchback Honda turun 28,63 persen secara tahunan. Jazz menurun 22,28 persen, sedangkan Civic 5D menurun 58,08 persen.
text:
Hatchback Market Drops, Honda Still Optimistic
Nov 6, 2019, 05:37 by Bisnis.com, Wawan Priyanto
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - PT Honda Prospect Motor (HPM) stated that the decline in sales of the hatchback sedan segment is in line with the decline in total sales in the domestic market.
HPM Director of Business Innovation and Marketing Sales Yusak Billy said this could be seen from the market share of this segment which did not change much to the total national vehicle market.
According to him, the contribution of the sedan buntung segment to the total domestic market is still in the range of 3 percent. Little has changed, although in total, during January-September the decline reached around 16 percent on an annual basis.
"The January-September hatchback market is down about 16 percent compared to the same period last year as the market dropped by 13 percent. However, the contribution of hatchback sales in the market is not too down, it is still around 3 percent, "he told Bisnis.com, Tuesday, November 5, 2019.
Under these conditions, according to him, Honda's dominance in the hatchback sedan market did not change much. This Japanese manufacturer, he continued, still dominates the market through the Jazz model which has a market share of around 46 percent.
Market demand in semester II / 2019 was also considered better compared to semester I / 2019. However, he said that in the period of October or the beginning of the last quarter of this year began a temporary decline.
"So our total hatchback is currently experiencing an annual decline of 16 percent. The 5D model is down 30 percent on an annual basis, while Jazz is down about 15 percent in that period," he said.
Quoting data from the Indonesian Automotive Industries Association (Gaikindo), there were at least seven brands that marketed the stump sedan model this year, including Suzuki, Toyota, Honda, and Mini.
During January-September, sales of hatchback sedans in the domestic market reached around 30,953 units, a decrease of 24.18 percent compared to the same period in the previous year.
This decline is higher than the condition of the industry which contracted 12.03 percent annually.
Honda is still listed as the market leader with the highest sales of hatchback sedans, reaching 9,467 units. This sales was contributed by the sales performance of the Jazz and Civic 5D models, each of which sold 8,481 units and 986 units.
Although still controlling about 30.59 percent of the market in this segment, Honda's sales recorded a significant decline. Total sales of Honda's hatchback sedans fell by 28.63 percent annually. Jazz decreased 22.28 percent, while the Civic 5D decreased 58.08 percent.
